author: Subodh Varma
description: In its 'Make India Water Positive' initiative, the Times of India addresses wastage and mismanagement of water.
title: India uses up more groundwater than US and China - Times of India

description: "Continued threat of high level terror attacks in India, violence in Kashmir and bilateral diplomatic recriminations will further strain India-Pakistan ties in 2017," a top American defence intelligence chief has told lawmakers.
title: India considering punitive actions against Pakistan: US official - Times of India

description: It is not worth spending more government funds on Air India’s revival
title: Maharajah of debt: On Air India’s revival

description: India begins the heavy-lifting needed to transform economic partnerships in Africa
title: Continental ties - India's outreach to Africa

author: ESPNcricinfo staff
description: India coach Anil Kumble will have to go through a
title: BCCI invites applications for India coach role; Kumble a direct entry

description: The UN has denied the Pakistani army's claim that Indian forces fired at a UN vehicle on the Line of Control yesterday.  Press reports in Pakistan last night quoted Pakistan army's media wing saying that India targeted a UN Military Observer Group in India and Pakistan (UNMOGIP) vehicle in Khanjar.
title: UN denies Pakistan's claim that India fired at a UN vehicle along LoC - Times of India

description: India is trying to extend its influence over the disputed South China Sea by exploring the possibility of setting up a tsunami early warning system for the region, something that China has reportedly also been working on.
title: India plans tsunami warning system for South China Sea - Times of India

author: Sachin Parashar
description: As concerns abound in India over Nepal’s decision to join China’s One Belt, One Road, Nepal has come out strongly to underscore the significance of its ties with India.  "We have joined OBOR but wthat will not undermine the relationship with India,’’ Nepal’s ambassador Deep Kumar Upadhyay said.
title: Nepal will carefully weigh use of funds from China: Nepal envoy - Times of India

author: Stephen Leahy
description: While President Trump wants to revive America’s coal industry, India is embracing renewables, LED lighting, electric cars, and more.
title: India Launches Massive Push for Clean Power, Lighting, and Cars

author: Rajat Pandit
description: Both India and Pakistan continue to maintain high operational military readiness along the volatile Line of Control (loC), with daily cross-border firing duels becoming the norm.
title: India, Pakistan maintain high operational military readiness along LoC - Times of India
